contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) that "the dead" and "spirits" are two different things or 2) that this is a doublet that means "the spirits of dead people." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
These phrases mean the same thing and emphasize the command for obedience. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])

The words "keep" and "carry out" mean the same thing. They emphasize that the people must obey God's commands. Alternate translation: "obey my commandments" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: keep my commandments and carry them out

contextId.occurrenceNote: These two phrases refer to God causing them to have many descendants so they become a large group. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: make you fruitful and multiply you
